snippet: The bipartisan legislation, which is expected to pass, falls short of critics’ demands for stronger measures against suspected currency manipulation by other countries.
abstract: House is expected to pass bipartisan trade and customs bill that would give Obama administration more muscle against unfair trade practices; measure's clout against suspected currency manipulation falls short of demands from critics in both parties.
lead_paragraph: The bipartisan legislation, which is expected to pass, falls short of critics’ demands for stronger measures against suspected currency manipulation by other countries.

headline.main: Compromise Bill Would Give President More Muscle Against Unfair Trade Practices
headline.print_headline: Compromise Bill Would Give President More Muscle Against Unfair Trade Practices
